titles: The countrey lasse. To a daintie new note, which if you can hit, there's another tune will as well fit. To the tune of, The mother beguild daughter.
author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?
publisher: Printed by the assignes of Thomas Symcocke,
notes: Place and date of publication suggested by STC.
Verse: "Although I am a countrey lasse ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
